health.nextAction: Execute top ready PantryPal experiment now and monitor first-hour guardrail.

queue.title: Personalized rescue recipes from expiring inventory
acceptanceCriteria: Experiment spec includes hypothesis, segment, channel, and success metric (weekly meal-plan saves).
A/B test is configured with event instrumentation and minimum detectable lift target of 12%.
Sample-size gate is defined: at least 1200 qualified households over 14 days.
Guardrail is monitored and passes: recipe dismiss rate stays below 20%.
Validation completed with command: npm test -- test/pantrypal-task-accelerator.test.js.
Decision log is updated with launch date, owner, and rollback trigger.

immediateExecution.title: Personalized rescue recipes from expiring inventory
acceptanceChecklist: Experiment spec includes hypothesis, segment, channel, and success metric (weekly meal-plan saves).
A/B test is configured with event instrumentation and minimum detectable lift target of 12%.
Sample-size gate is defined: at least 1200 qualified households over 14 days.
executionNow: Draft experiment brief in tracker with owner + rollout window.
Prepare treatment/control variants and QA events in staging.
Gate launch against acceptance checklist (3 critical checks).
Launch to 10% holdout split and monitor first-hour guardrail.

experimentSpecTemplate.title: Personalized rescue recipes from expiring inventory
experimentSpecTemplate.hypothesis: If we run "Personalized rescue recipes from expiring inventory" for qualified PantryPal households, then personalized rescue recipes from expiring inventory should improve its primary success metric while keeping guardrails healthy.
experimentSpecTemplate.segment: Qualified PantryPal households active in the past 14 days
acceptanceCriteria: Experiment spec includes hypothesis, segment, channel, and success metric (weekly meal-plan saves).
A/B test is configured with event instrumentation and minimum detectable lift target of 12%.
Sample-size gate is defined: at least 1200 qualified households over 14 days.
Guardrail is monitored and passes: recipe dismiss rate stays below 20%.
Validation completed with command: npm test -- test/pantrypal-task-accelerator.test.js.
Decision log is updated with launch date, owner, and rollback trigger.
